sequence:
Blessings and Tidings

<size=45>Chapter 1: Greetings and Meetings?</size>

scripts.say: Mhm... That should be the last item on the shopping list.
"Lady Nagato, you mustn't sully your hands with common work; please leave it to us and return to the castle."
Kawakaze and the others can be so stiff at times... I, too, wish to assist everyone in the New Year's preparations.
The Guardian Fox of the Sakura Empire... perhaps us meeting here is a "sign" of the things to come.
Friedrich der Große of the Iron Blood... Hmm, what in the world is with that outfit...?
Yes, this is a kimono from your own Sakura Empire. Exquisitely crafted, comfortable to the touch, and elegantly designed, this is indeed a product of the highest caliber.
(Since when did they make kimonos that looked like this...?!)
(First Akagi, then St. Louis... Now everyone is dressing like this...? Ugh... I feel like I've lost something valuable...)
Huh? Lady Friedrich der Große of the Iron Blood? Lady Nagato of the Sakura Empire?
Geh?! ...Ahem! You're from the Royal Maids?
Um... former maid... That place was a bit too hectic for me~
I'm now one of the Royal Knights!
I see...
You're also dressed in a kimono... The Royal Navy also seems to come prepared...
I am honoured by your praise! Lady Friedrich der Große, your appearance is also... most striking...
I am glad that both of your factions have taken interest in our customs. As such, I welcome you both to come to our shrine to celebrate Shougatsu with us.
Shougatsu...? If I recall, that was the Sakura Empire's ceremony to welcome in the coming year?
Oh, Cleveland mentioned something about that and a sport called "hanetsuki," right? I somehow ended up being dragged in to serve as a referee.
(Th-they're talking right past each other...! What a fearsome display of a culture gap...!)
Hanetsuki sounds like f– I mean... Ahem! Perhaps if the opportunity arises...
